intro: Leiothrix vivipara, commonly known as the viviparous fern, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its viviparous reproductive method, where the spores develop into small plantlets on the underside of its fronds before being released. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its fronds are usually narrow and elongated, with a delicate, feathery appearance. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, Leiothrix vivipara is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
